definition: selfless/impartial
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
personal/private/selfish

sentences.english: A fair game depends on an unbiased referee.
sentences.chinese: 一场公平的赛事取决于一位大公无私的球证。

sentences.english: I deem that a king conforming to Tao should be selfless.
sentences.chinese: 我认为合于道的君王应该是大公无私的。

sentences.english: It is impossible for me to be impartial.
sentences.chinese: 我不可能做到大公无私。

sentences.english: But members of the league could also have less altruistic motives.
sentences.chinese: 但是，阿盟各成员国的动机也谈不上大公无私。

sentences.english: Such is Shen Hao, a diligent, warm­hearted and selfless man.
sentences.chinese: 这就是沈浩，一个勤奋，热心而又大公无私的人。

sentences.english: They discussed how to emulate the selfless spirit of these comrades.
sentences.chinese: 他们讨论如何学习这些同志大公无私的精神。

sentences.english: Everyone has to bow before the selfless time.
sentences.chinese: 在大公无私的时间前面，谁也不能不低头认输。

sentences.english: Her unselfish act reflects well on her upbringing.
sentences.chinese: 她的大公无私行为充分体现出她受过良好的教养。

sentences.english: It is the working class that is most selfless.
Although nowadays people in mounting numbers talk about the need to be unselfish.
sentences.chinese: 尽管现在越来越多的人谈论到大公无私的必要性。

sentences.english: Aunt Estelle's unselfishness was her greatest gift.
sentences.chinese: 埃斯特尔姨妈的大公无私是她最好的礼物。

sentences.english: It was an excellent lesson in fairness and sticking to your guns.
sentences.chinese: 就大公无私以及坚持立场而言，这是绝妙的一课。

definition: to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
upright and plainspoken
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous/openhearted/unselfish/magnanimous/broad-minded
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
to give up one's private interests for the public good (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless and public spirited
selfless/unselfish/disinterested/altruistic
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
to distinguish right from wrong (idiom)
desire for the public good/sense of fair play
